TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {5490=Welcome to the 10th lesson about verbs in Zulu. We will first learn about the present tense, followed by the past tense, and future tense. We will also analyze some grammar rules, and finally practice how to ask for direction in Zulu.}
textBeforeTable: The future tense in Zulu conveys a situation or event which is anticipated to happen in the future. Here are some examples: bavakashele ekenya they visited Kenya sivakashele emexico we visited Mexico uvakashele eshayina she visited China uvakashele emorocco he visited Morocco uvakashele entaliyana you visited Italy ngivakashele e-france I visited France Zulu Past Tense The past tense in Zulu conveys a situation (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
textAfterTable: Now let's take a break and refresh our vocabulary by learning the body parts. ear indlebe eye iso mouth umlomo nose ikhala hair izinwele face ubuso head ikhanda heart
